boat.name: Mary Ellen
boat.full_description: Had been suggested that this was a shrimper, hull form negates this view, similarly was said to be 2 or 3 foot longer on deck, if she is sawn off, it is a very professionla cut. "Thursday 31st August 1995. - The morning was wet and miserable. I took the Dinghy to the long floating causeway at the foot of the boatyard. I wanted to look in the shed at the top of the slip-way because I was told that my first boat ‘Mary of Chester’ was under re-fit there. After a while the rain stopped and I went to see Mary. Certainly she was there, with transom removed as the current owner was planning build a counter stern (something she had managed to do without in all her 105 years!).(John Langrick)"
boat.construction_details: Oak on Oak Carvel, iron ballast keel, had centre plate
